definitions: The beginning of a process or development that is likely to lead to something much larger, more serious, or more undesirable.
A minor change or concession that is seen as a precursor to a series of larger, more significant, and often unwelcome changes.
examples: Allowing a small exception could be the thin end of the wedge.
Many feared the new policy was the thin end of the wedge for privacy.
He warned that this small compromise was the thin end of the wedge.
